constituent: death, bones, one, ceiling, evening, spoon, sitting on the ground
heisigStory: Bones . . . spoon. Note how the first stroke is extended to the right, forming a sort of "roof" overhead.
koohiiStory1: Ok, this is where knowing some Eastern culture comes in handy! In Japanese society, when someone dies they creamate the body and pick out the remaining bones with special chopsticks. In this case, they´re out of chopsticks so they decide to use (gasp!) a spoon instead.
koohiiStory2: Imagine the grim reaper (the bringer of death), carrying a spoon made of human bones instead of a scythe.
myStory: sự chết. cái thìa và sự chết
words:
死(し): death, decease
死刑(しけい): death penalty, capital punishment
生死(せいし): life and death
死体(したい): corpse
死亡(しぼう): death, mortality
必死(ひっし): inevitable death, desperation, frantic, inevitable result
死ぬ(しぬ): to die
